meanings.definition: To pull or drag with force
meanings.sent1: The farmer haled the heavy cart up the hill.
meanings.sent2: She haled the suitcase behind her as she walked to the train station.
meanings.sent3: The little dog haled the big bone across the yard, looking quite determined.
meanings.sent4: The strong winds haled the leaves off the trees, swirling them into the air.
meanings.sent5: The hero haled the trapped villagers to safety, showing great strength.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she haled the boxes into the storage room.
meanings.sent2: He haled the fishing net onto the boat after a successful catch.
meanings.sent3: The kids haled the sled up the snowy hill, giggling all the way.
meanings.sent4: The old truck haled the heavy load without any trouble, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent5: The workers haled the equipment to the construction site early in the morning.
